JobFullDesc: Job Description:The Material Management Specialist (MMS) is responsible for the inventory and resolving any deficiencies reported during the inventory of all Major End Item’s (MEIs) prior to and during System Integration and Check-Out (SICO).  The Specialist is responsible for receiving, unpacking, inspecting all supplies and equipment required for SICO, and inducting materials into SAP software Integrated Maintenance Repair and Overhaul (iMRO) inventory. MMS identifies logistics strategies in capture phase, and will ensure execution and continuous improvement of standard logistics processes, such as replenishment systems, data interchange systems, demand management, electronic data systems administration, warehouse operations, and related functions. This individual will build relationships and communicate with internal and external customers through logistics initiatives, and is responsible for making improvements of processes, systems or products to enhance performance of the job area. The MMS will also be required to issuing, requisition and disposition all replacement parts and tools and test equipment during SICO, as well as warehouse operations that will enable the receipt, stock, storage and issue of repair parts, consumables, Line Replaceable Unit (LRU) and Battery Replaceable Unit (BRU) spares. The individual will create and well as reduce supply requirements based on inventory adjustments, as well receiving and reviewing requirements for non-standard parts. The individual is responsible for the receipt, delivery, inspection and/or test of incoming material, central stores/warehousing of program and/or contractor acquired material and packaging and shipping services for OCONUS sites. He or she will ensure that appropriate documentation is provided to logistics organization so that proper receipt is recorded. The MMS must work with the Quality engineer in the Handoff of Material to customer, and will aid in the receipt of Spares under the FCS and DMR program occurring during the SICO time frame. The individual will report all activities to the SICO Lead. The KSA Government requires all individuals residing in, and entering its borders to be completely COVID-19 vaccinated. This position is for a short term international assignment in the city of Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.
